cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Jacksonville, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-north-eastward, skirting the Southeast coast today, forecast to move inland over eastern North Carolina tonight and then track quickly up the mid-Atlantic seaboard toward the Northeast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South/North Carolina border (around Surf City/Bald Head Island, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Watch Hill RI to Stonington ME, including Martha's Vineyard, Nantucket and Block Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Surf City NC to west of Watch Hill RI, including Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Delaware Bay, Long Island and Long Island Sound, Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from northeastern South Carolina through the mid-Atlantic to coastal New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; there is a 26 % chance of sustained 50 kt (58 mph) winds with higher gusts as the center passes close on Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible in Delaware Bay; minor tidal flooding could propagate up the Delaware River toward the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 8 inches, producing flash and urban flooding potential in the Philadelphia metro area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible Tuesday; hazardous seas and strong rip currents along the nearby New Jersey/Delaware coasts; brief interruptions to marine traffic on the Delaware River due to strong currents and rising water.
